intro: Eupatoriopsis hoffmanniana, commonly known as Hoffmann's eupatoriopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
